Class SimulateDispersal¶

  • Defined in File SimulateDispersal.h

Class Documentation¶

class SimulateDispersal¶

Contains routines for importing a density map file, running a dispersal kernel n times on a landscape and record the dispersal distances.

Public Functions

SimulateDispersal()¶
~SimulateDispersal()¶
void setSequential(bool bSequential)¶

Sets the is_sequential flag.

Parameters
  • bSequential: if true, dispersal events are selected using the end point of the last dispersal distance for the start of the next move event

void setSizes(unsigned long x, unsigned long y)¶

Sets the sizes of the density map.

Parameters
  • x: the x dimension (number of columns) in the density map
  • y: the y dimension (number of rows) in the density map

void importMaps(string map_file)¶

Import the map from the prescribed file.

Parameters
  • map_file: the map file to import from

void setSeed(unsigned long s)¶

Sets the seed for the random number generator.

Parameters
  • s: the seed

void setDispersalParameters(string dispersal_method_in, double sigma_in, double tau_in, double m_prob_in, double cutoff_in, string landscape_type)¶

Sets the dispersal parameters.

Parameters
  • dispersal_method_in: the dispersal method (e.g. “normal”)
  • sigma_in: the sigma value for normal and fat-tailed dispersals
  • tau_in: the nu value for fat-tailed dispersals
  • m_prob_in: the m_prob for norm-uniform dispersals
  • cutoff_in: the maximum dispersal distance for norm-uniform dispersal
  • landscape_type: string containing the landscape type (one of “closed”, “tiled” or “infinite”).

void setLandscapeType(string landscape_type)¶
void setOutputDatabase(string out_database)¶

Sets the output database for writing results to.

Parameters
  • out_database: path to the output database

void setNumberRepeats(unsigned long n)¶

Sets the number of repeats to run the dispersal kernel for.

Parameters
  • n: the number of repeats

void storeCellList()¶

Calculates the list of cells to choose randomly from.

const Cell &getRandomCell()¶

Gets a random cell from the list of cells.

Return
a Cell object reference containing the x and y positions to choose from

bool getEndPointInfinite(double dist, double angle, Cell &this_cell)¶

Checks the density is greater than 0 a given distance from the start point on an infinite null landscape.

This also takes into account the rejection sampling of density based on the maximal density value from the map.

Return
true if the point has a density > 0, otherwise generates a random number between 0 and the max size and if it is > the density, return true, false otherwise.
Parameters
  • dist: the distance of dispersal
  • angle: the angle of dispersal
  • this_cell: Cell containing the x and y coordinates of the starting position

bool getEndPointTiled(double dist, double angle, Cell &this_cell)¶

Checks the density is greater than 0 a given distance from the start point on an infinite tiled landscape.

This also takes into account the rejection sampling of density based on the maximal density value from the map.

Return
true if the point has a density > 0, otherwise generates a random number between 0 and the max size and if it is > the density, return true, false otherwise.
Parameters
  • dist: the distance of dispersal
  • angle: the angle of dispersal
  • this_cell: Cell containing the x and y coordinates of the starting position

bool getEndPointClosed(double dist, double angle, Cell &this_cell)¶

Checks the density a given distance from the start point on an closed landscape.

This also takes into account the rejection sampling of density based on the maximal density value from the map.

Return
true if the point has a density > 0, otherwise generates a random number between 0 and the max size and if it is > the density, return true, false otherwise.
Parameters
  • dist: the distance of dispersal
  • angle: the angle of dispersal
  • this_cell: Cell containing the x and y coordinates of the starting position

bool getEndPoint(double dist, double angle, Cell &this_cell)¶

Checks the density a given distance from the start point, calling the relevant landscape function.

This also takes into account the rejection sampling of density based on the maximal density value from the map.

Return
true if the point has a density > 0, otherwise generates a random number between 0 and the max size and if it is > the density, return true, false otherwise.
Parameters
  • dist: the distance of dispersal
  • angle: the angle of dispersal
  • this_cell: Cell containing the x and y coordinates of the starting position

void runDispersal()¶

Runs the dispersal loop the given number of times for the set parameters.

void writeDatabase()¶

Writes out the distances to the SQL database.
